name: South Indian Filter Coffee
history: South Indian Filter Coffee, also known as 'Kapi', is a popular beverage in Southern India. It is known for its unique brewing method using a metal filter and its strong, frothy texture.
description: Filter Coffee is a strong, milky coffee brewed with a special Indian filter. It's typically made with fresh roasted and ground coffee beans, mixed with chicory, and served hot with a distinct froth.

equipment.name: South Indian coffee filter
equipment.description: A metal device used for brewing the coffee.

instructions.title: Brew the Coffee
instructions.description: Add the coffee powder to the filter compartment. Pour hot water over it and cover. Let the coffee brew for about 7-10 minutes. The decoction (concentrated coffee) will collect in the bottom compartment.

instructions.title: Boil the Milk
instructions.description: Meanwhile, boil the milk in a saucepan. You can add sugar to the milk as per your taste.

instructions.title: Mix Coffee and Milk
instructions.description: In a coffee mug or tumbler, add the brewed coffee decoction as per your taste (usually about 1/4 of the cup). Fill the rest of the mug with the boiled milk.

instructions.title: Froth the Coffee
instructions.description: To create froth, pour the coffee back and forth between the mug and another container from a height. Do this a few times until the coffee is frothy.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the coffee hot in the mug or tumbler. Enjoy the rich and frothy South Indian Filter Coffee.

tips: Adjust the amount of coffee decoction and milk according to your taste preference.
The key to a good filter coffee is the quality of the coffee powder and the brewing time.
variations: For a vegan option, use almond milk or soy milk.
Try adding spices like cardamom or ginger for a flavored twist.

storage.instructions: It's not recommended to store brewed coffee for long periods.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat only the milk if necessary and then mix with the coffee decoction.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional brass or stainless steel tumbler and saucer.
Garnish with a sprinkle of cocoa powder for a decorative touch.
